title: PHQ-9 Depression Assessment
description: This questionnaire is a tool that helps assess depression levels. Please indicate how often you have been bothered by the following over the past two weeks.

questions.text: I have little interest or pleasure in doing things
I am feeling down, depressed, or hopeless
I have trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
I am feeling tired or having little energy
I have poor appetite or I am overeating
I am feeling bad about myself — or I feel I am a failure or I have let myself or my family down
I have trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television
I am moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed? Or the opposite — I am being so fidgety or restless that I have been moving around more than usual
I have thoughts that I would be better off dead, or of hurting yourself

ranges.guidance: Your current score suggests minimal or no depression. May not require treatment for depression, but this doesn't rule out other mental health issues.
Your current score indicates mild to moderate depression. Patients should be further evaluated to determine the most appropriate intervention.
Your current score suggests moderately severe to severe depression. Active treatment with psychotherapy, medications, or a combination is typically necessary.
